entry.title: Is the validated VSaaS LMS eligible for using the Instant Refresh Tool?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts.

We are ready to refresh the LMS validated environment from Production (Source) to the lower environment Sandbox and Staging (Target). We heard conflicting information on the option to use the Instant Refresh Tool for validated LMS environment. Our Platform (BizX) environment is not validated and can use the instance refresh tool. 

Please help me with the answer to this question. Thank you,

Connie

entry.title: SAP Focused Run: Trigger custom actions on work modes in IT Calendar & Work Mode Management
entry.content:
A work mode represents a specific operational state or event of a system, for instance, when it is taken offline for maintenance or is temporarily unavailable. These modes help both users and administrators stay informed about the current status of their systems. 

You can create and manage work modes using the IT Calendar and & Work Mode Management application in SAP Focused Run. One of the key work mode types is Planned Downtime, which is used when a system is deliberately taken offline for maintenance or updates. During a planned downtime, alerts for the affected system are automatically suppressed, helping to avoid unnecessary notifications while maintenance is in progress.

With SAP Focused Run 5.2, you can now trigger your own custom actions as follow-ups to planned maintenance events. For example, SAP Focused Run includes the Operations Automation application, which provides system health check guided procedures to help assess the health of managed systems. A guided procedure consists of predefined steps and activities that guide you through the health check process. You can either use a SAP-delivered health check guided procedure or create a custom one tailored to your specific requirements.

Let us now see how we can run one of these guided procedures before, during, or after a maintenance event, making it easier to automate health checks and streamline your maintenance processes. 

First stage: Backend Configuration

Background job SAP_FRN_WMM_EXT_TRIGGER_ACTION runs every five minutes and identifies work modes that meet any of the following criteria: 

  1. Work modes that started or ended in the last 5 minutes 
  2. Ongoing work modes 
  3. Work mode that will start or end in the next 5 minutes 

All the work modes identified by the background job are then passed to the BAdI: BADI_TRIGGER_ACTION_ON_WMM for further processing. This BAdI provides different methods that are called based on the timing of the work mode in relation to the current time. The methods are defined as follows: 

  1. PROCESS_WMM_PRE_RUN - This method receives all work modes with start time or end time within the last five minutes (i.e., five minutes before the current time).
  2. PROCESS_ONGOING_WMM   - This method receives all ongoing work modes. That is all work modes that are currently active. 
  3. PROCESS_WMM_POST_RUN - This method handles work modes where the start time or end time falls within the next five minutes (i.e., five minutes after the current time). 

According to the use case, the customer can implement the methods listed above.As explained before, we can explore the use case to trigger a guided procedure which will perform the system health check for the managed system on which maintenance event is planned. 

Let us look at an example where we trigger a guided procedure using this BAdI 

  1. Create a Z BAdI implementation for BAdI: BADI_TRIGGER_ACTION_ON_WMM .
  2. We want to trigger the guided procedure execution within 5 minutes of the maintenance event completion. So, for this implement method PROCESS_WMM_POST_RUN with below sample code. 

Sample code snippet

METHOD if_trigger_action_on_wmm~process_wmm_post_run.

DATA: ls_object TYPE sdiagls_base_landscape,
           ls_log TYPE itcal_s_trigger_wmm_logs,
          lr_landscape_obj TYPE REF TO cl_diagls_base_landscape,
         lr_technical_system TYPE REF TO cl_diagls_technical_system,
        lv_jname TYPE tbtcjob-jobname,
       lv_inst_number TYPE diag_global_id,
      lr_database TYPE REF TO cl_diagls_database,
     lt_messages TYPE bapiret2_t.

FIELD-SYMBOLS <fs_struc> TYPE any.

TRY.

LOOP AT it_wm_details ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_wm_details>) .
IF <fs_wm_details>-lmdb_guid EQ <fs_wm_details>-lmdb_parent_guid. "Restricting technical components


"Fetch system details using lmdb guid.

DATA(lv_lmdb_guid36) = cl_lmdb_guid_util=>convert_guid_c32_to_c36( guid = <fs_wm_details>-lmdb_guid ).

DATA(lr_base_obj) = cl_gpa_exec_util=>get_ts_by_guid(
im_lmdb_guid36 = '' && lv_lmdb_guid36 )-base_landscape.
ls_object = cl_gpa_exec_util=>get_ts_by_guid(
im_lmdb_guid36 = '' && lv_lmdb_guid36 ).


*Database managed system

IF cl_diagls_util=>is_database( im_base_landscape = lr_base_obj ).
lr_database ?= lr_base_obj.
DATA(lv_id) = lr_database->get_id( ).
DATA(lv_typ) = lr_database->get_type( ).

CALL FUNCTION 'FM_EXTRN_GP_EXEC'
EXPORTING
iv_gp_id = '' "Provide GP id(required field)
iv_rep_type = 'HTML'
iv_system_id = lv_id
iv_system_type = lv_typ
iv_mailtpl = '' "Provide a mail template(required field)
run_background = abap_true
* iv_recipient_list = ''
IMPORTING
ev_jobname = lv_jname
ev_instance_number = lv_inst_number
et_messages = lt_messages.

ls_log-wm_id = <fs_wm_details>-wmm_id.
ls_log-log_text = |Guided procedure scheduled in background. Job name is { lv_jname }|.
ls_log-context_guid = <fs_wm_details>-lmdb_guid.
GET TIME STAMP FIELD ls_log-timestamp.
APPEND ls_log TO it_logs.

*Technical system


ELSEIF cl_diagls_util=>is_technical_system( im_base_landscape = lr_base_obj ).

lr_base_obj->get_structure_as_data(
RECEIVING
re_structure = DATA(lr_struc_data) " Common data shared amongt all Landscape entities.
).
ASSIGN lr_struc_data->* TO <fs_struc>.
IF sy-subrc = 0.

DATA lv_sid TYPE char255.
DATA lv_type TYPE char255.

ASSIGN COMPONENT 'SID' OF STRUCTURE <fs_struc> TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<lv_sid>).
IF sy-subrc = 0.
lv_sid = <lv_sid>.
ENDIF.

ASSIGN COMPONENT 'TYPE' OF STRUCTURE <fs_struc> TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<lv_type>).
IF sy-subrc = 0.
lv_type = <lv_type>.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.
CALL FUNCTION 'FM_EXTRN_GP_EXEC'
EXPORTING
iv_gp_id = '' "Provide GP id(required field)
iv_rep_type = 'HTML'
iv_system_id = lv_sid
iv_system_type = lv_type
iv_mailtpl = '' "Provide a mail template(required field)
run_background = abap_true
* iv_recipient_list = ''
IMPORTING
ev_jobname = lv_jname
ev_instance_number = lv_inst_number
et_messages = lt_messages.
ls_log-wm_id = <fs_wm_details>-wmm_id.
ls_log-log_text = |Guided procedure scheduled in background. Job name is { lv_jname }|.
ls_log-context_guid = <fs_wm_details>-lmdb_guid.
GET TIME STAMP FIELD ls_log-timestamp.
APPEND ls_log TO it_logs.


*Host

ELSEIF cl_diagls_util=>is_host( im_base_landscape = lr_base_obj ).
lv_sid = lr_base_obj->get_id( ).
CALL FUNCTION 'FM_EXTRN_GP_EXEC'
EXPORTING
iv_gp_id = '' "Provide GP id(required field)
iv_rep_type = 'HTML'
iv_system_id = lv_sid
iv_mailtpl = '' "Provide a mail template(required field)
run_background = abap_true
iv_host = 'X'
* iv_recipient_list = ''
IMPORTING
ev_jobname = lv_jname
ev_instance_number = lv_inst_number
et_messages = lt_messages.
ls_log-wm_id = <fs_wm_details>-wmm_id.
ls_log-log_text = |Guided procedure scheduled in background. Job name is { lv_jname }|.
ls_log-context_guid = <fs_wm_details>-lmdb_guid.
GET TIME STAMP FIELD ls_log-timestamp.
APPEND ls_log TO it_logs.


*External service


ELSEIF cl_diagls_util=>is_external_service( im_base_landscape = lr_base_obj ).

lr_base_obj->get_structure_as_data(
RECEIVING
re_structure = lr_struc_data " Common data shared amongt all Landscape entities.
).
ASSIGN lr_struc_data->* TO <fs_struc>.
ASSIGN COMPONENT 'LONG_SID' OF STRUCTURE <fs_struc> TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<lv_long_sid>).
IF sy-subrc = 0.
lv_sid = <lv_long_sid>.
ENDIF.

ASSIGN COMPONENT 'APPLICATION_DOMAIN' OF STRUCTURE <fs_struc> TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<lv_app_domain>).
IF sy-subrc = 0.
lv_type = <lv_app_domain>.
ENDIF.
CALL FUNCTION 'FM_EXTRN_GP_EXEC'
EXPORTING
iv_gp_id = '' "Provide GP id(required field)
iv_rep_type = 'HTML'
iv_system_id = lv_sid
iv_system_type = lv_type
iv_mailtpl = '' "Provide a mail template(required field)
run_background = abap_true
* iv_recipient_list = ''
IMPORTING
ev_jobname = lv_jname
ev_instance_number = lv_inst_number
et_messages = lt_messages.
ls_log-wm_id = <fs_wm_details>-wmm_id.
ls_log-log_text = |Guided procedure scheduled in background. Job name is { lv_jname }|.
ls_log-context_guid = <fs_wm_details>-lmdb_guid.
GET TIME STAMP FIELD ls_log-timestamp.
APPEND ls_log TO it_logs.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.
ENDLOOP.
CATCH cx_sise_exception.
ENDTRY.
ENDMETHOD.

Second stage:Plan a maintenance event

  • In the IT Calendar & Work Mode Management application, create a work mode for any managed system.

      

As per our BAdI implementation, within 5 minutes of the work mode's completion guided procedure should be triggered.

  • Once the work mode is finished, choose Action Logs on the event in the IT calendar to see the logs we have provided in   the BAdI implementation.

All logs generated as part of your implementation will be available here. For our sample use case, you can include details such as the guided procedure ID, name, guided procedure runtime status etc. 

  • You can also verify the guided procedure execution in the Operations Automation app.  Choose System management as the application area to verify health check guided procedure instance that was triggered from the work mode.

Conclusion

By using event-based actions in IT Calendar & Work Mode Management, we can ensure that important maintenance activities are automatically handled at the right time. The background job and BAdI together support custom logic and system-specific actions. This approach enhances operational efficiency and helps administrators maintain better visibility and control during maintenance cycles.

entry.title: Change of Technical Administrator (Americas Region)
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team

We kindly request to update the Technical Administrator for the Order Form (Case ID) listed below.
*We confirmed with our account manager that the request should be submitted under the component: XX-SER-SAPSMP-USR. However, since we are unable to locate it, we kindly ask you to forward this internally within SAP.
 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Change of Technical Administrator (Americas Region)
entry.content:
Firstly, I have to inform you that the XX-SER-SAPSMP-USR provided by Account Manager has already been sunset, so you cannot select this component to report a case. Additionally, SAP for Me support generally issues related to S-users and S-user roles. Regarding the change of the technical administrator for your order, I tried to find the following information for your reference:

1. According to your description "update the Technical Administrator for the Order Form ", not sure if you mean update the Purchase Order and/or Maintenance Responsible Contacts.

If in that case, the KBA 3597947 - How to create and manage Purchase Order and/or Maintenance Responsible Contacts using 'Your Finance Contacts' card - SAP for Me is relevant. Attached the screenshot for your reference.

2. If it's not the situation mentioned above, then I think SAP for Me probably does not support this feature. I found an internal KBA 3423106 - How to change billing contact person - SAP for Me [INTERNAL ONLY] in the backend system, but since it is internal, customers cannot review it. I have abstracted the content for your reference. You may contact your Account Manager to see if they can help you create an IT ticket to resolve this issue. Your Account Manager can view this internal KBA thus please also provide it to him.

Resolution

Contact the Account Manager and provide below necessary information:

  • ERP number
  • Sales organization/company code (for example 0001 for SAP SE, 0015 for SAP Asia etc.)
  • Requested e-mail address
  • Does this relate to all LOBs or only specific LOB/billing type?

Then the Account Manager should create an IT Ticket (Type : O2I Digital Invoice Delivery ) to change the billing contact person.

For Ariba, please refer to document: https://one.int.sap/functional_areas/finance/order_to_invoice/digital_invoice_delivery.

entry.title: Why SAP Introduced Fiori Spaces & Pages
entry.content:
SAP Fiori Spaces and Pages are the modern way of structuring the SAP Launchpad in S/4HANA.
They define how users see their apps, how navigation is organized, and how roles are delivered in a clean, controlled, and role-based layout.

Spaces & Pages replace the old Groups concept with a much more powerful and user-friendly approach.

The Problem with Old “Groups”

Fiori Groups were simple, but they created massive operational and UX challenges in S/4HANA environments:

Inconsistent Across Users

Users could hide/reorder tiles → no standard layout.
Impossible to enforce governance.

Overloaded Launchpads

Many users had 80–120 tiles, making it slow and hard to use.

Not Role-Based

Groups didn’t represent business roles or personas (CFO, Controller, AP, AR, Treasury Manager).

Poor Navigation

Scrolling through endless tiles led to productivity loss.

Not Future-Proof

Groups do not support SAP’s modern UX roadmap (OVP, UI5 innovations, predictive analytics).

Result:
Low adoption, poor user satisfaction, and high training/support efforts.

 

How Fiori Spaces & Pages Solve These Problems

Spaces & Pages are SAP’s modern approach to delivering a role-based, consistent, scalable, and intuitive launchpad.

True Role-Based UX (Persona-Centric)

Each role gets a dedicated Space:

  • CFO Space
  • Controller Space
  • AP Space
  • AR Space
  • Treasury Space

Every user sees the same consistent layout, reducing:

  • confusion
  • training effort
  • troubleshooting
  • audit issues

Clean, Structured, Multi-Level Navigation

Spaces → Pages → Sections → Tiles

This hierarchy aligns perfectly with end-to-end finance processes.

Example for CFO:

  • Space: CFO Insights
    • Page 1: Finance Insights
    • Page 2: Corporate Finance
    • Page 3: Treasury & Cash
    • Page 4: AP/AR Operations

Enterprise Governance

Spaces restrict user personalization.

Users cannot delete, move, or add tiles, preventing:

  • clutter
  • incorrect layouts
  • unauthorized tile usage
  • configuration mistakes

Perfect for SOX, audit, and compliance-driven organizations.

Faster Navigation and Better Performance

Pages load faster, are logically grouped, and allow CFOs to find critical insights in seconds — not minutes.

Standardization Across the Organization

Every user with the same role sees the same design:
Perfect for:

  • global teams
  • multi-country deployments
  • shared service centers
  • integration with training & SOPs

entry.title: Re: SAP Learning Hub subscription issue
entry.content:
Dear customer,

The website of SAP Learning Hub or SAP Training Center are not supported by SAP Technical Support through a case/expert chat that are created via SAP for Me.

For any issue with SAP Learning Hub or SAP Training Center, could you pls kindly refer to KBA 2404504 - How to get help with the SAP Learning Hub or SAP Training Center and find the official support channel to reach the support team of SAP Learning Hub or SAP Training Center?

------------------------------------------------------------------------
To get help for the SAP Training Center or SAP Learning Hub, use "Get Support" or "Get technical help" respectively. Then, select the "Create a case" option to request support with Training Center/Learning Hub.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hope the above information helps.

Thanks and regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: how do we get the goal id for goal import
entry.content: You need the goal ID only for editing or deleting. For this you need to create an ad-hoc report to extract the IDs. Let me know if this works.

entry.title: Re: how do we get the goal id for goal import
entry.content: You only need the ID for editing or deleting the goal. Create an ad-hoc report to extract the goal IDs and then use them in your import template. Hope this helps.

entry.title: Analyze Production Cost – Event-based
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

entry.title: Re: Analyze Production Cost – Event-based
entry.content:
Please check help for the field From Fiscal Period.

It shows:

Fiscal Period From / To

The current fiscal period is shown by default, and you can adjust the date range as required.

Only postings within the specified time frame are considered.

If an order has no postings in the date range you specify, it will appear in the table with zeros for each value.

Note that this is different to the Event-Based Work in Process app, where orders without postings are not shown.

 

------------------------------------------------------

In another word, the restriction is on postings, not on the closed date.

entry.title: Re: Configuration currently locked in "Manage G/L Account...
entry.content:
Please refer to the following advice for your issue

Symptom

  • Error message: "Changes not possible. Configuration locked" displayed in the Manage G/L Account Master Data app [1]
  • G/L account modifications blocked in Development system (DEV)
  • System preventing any changes to chart of accounts configuration

Current Situation Analysis

  • Locked System: Development environment experiencing configuration lock
  • Pending Transport: Chart of accounts transport request currently in Quality environment
  • Business Impact: Critical - unable to make necessary G/L account changes for business operations

Root Cause Investigation

The configuration lock typically occurs due to several possible scenarios:

  1. System Upgrade Phase: During system upgrades, changes are temporarily blocked to prevent conflicts [2]
  2. Transport Dependencies: Conflicting transport requests between development and quality systems
  3. User Lock Conflicts: Another user may have an open draft or be editing the same accounts [3]

Resolution Options

Option 1: Check for Open Drafts in Successor App
  1. Access the 'Manage Operating G/L Accounts' application
  2. Click on Edit to access any existing drafts
  3. Discard the existing draft to release the lock [3]
  4. Return to 'Manage G/L Account Master Data' app to make changes
Option 2: BCP Project Management (If During Upgrade Phase)
  1. Create a new BCP (Business Configuration Project) in the development system [2]
  2. Assign your user to the BCP project before making changes
  3. Ensure the BCP project is open and active for G/L account modifications
  4. Use the Synchronize App if urgent changes need to reach production during upgrade phase [2]
Option 3: Transport Coordination Approach
  1. Coordinate with the transport owner in Quality environment
  2. Import the pending chart of accounts transport back to Development
  3. Merge configuration changes in Development system
  4. Create a new consolidated transport request
  5. Move the updated transport through the system landscape

Step-by-Step Resolution

  1. Immediate Check: Verify if you're in a system upgrade phase by checking system status
  2. Draft Verification: Access 'Manage Operating G/L Accounts' app to check for open drafts [3]
  3. User Assignment: Ensure your user is assigned to an active BCP project if in upgrade phase [2]
  4. Transport Analysis: Review the relationship between DEV changes and QAS transport
  5. Execute Resolution: Apply the most appropriate resolution option based on findings
  6. Validate Changes: Confirm G/L account modifications can be made successfully

Validation Checklist

  • Configuration lock successfully released
  • G/L account changes applied without errors
  • Transport request created or updated appropriately
  • No system inconsistencies detected
  • Quality environment transport status verified

Preventive Measures

  • Establish clear transport coordination procedures between development and quality teams
  • Create BCP projects before system upgrade phases begin [2]
  • Assign users to BCP projects proactively during upgrade periods
  • Implement regular checks for open drafts in G/L account management apps
  • Maintain documentation of active transport requests across system landscape

Key Considerations

In a standard three-tier SAP S/4HANA system landscape, all G/L account configurations should be performed in the Development system and transported systematically to Test/Quality and Production systems [1]. The Quality and Production systems typically have read-only access to prevent unauthorized changes.


If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudo. This motivates me to serve you better

Br.Bob

entry.title: Smarter Skills-Based Hiring with SAP Fieldglass
entry.content:
SAP Fieldglass makes skills-based hiring faster and more accurate. With flexible placement of qualifications, AI-suggested skills, a unified qualifications library, standardized 1–5 rating scales, and smarter candidate matching based on qualifications—not just job codes— buyers and suppliers get clearer insights and better-aligned candidates with less manual effort.

These enhancements help organizations find the right talent quickly and consistently.

1. Enable Skills-Based Hiring Where It Matters Most 

Hiring needs differ across contingent types and roles. SAP Fieldglass lets you decide exactly where to apply skills-based hiring—at either the contingent type level or on job posting templates. 

This flexibility means the Qualifications section appears where you need it most, ensuring skill requirements are visible and consistent without disrupting existing postings. Buyers can communicate expectations clearly, while suppliers instantly understand what’s required. 

 
Use Case 

A professional services firm hiring temporary consultants enabled Skills-Based Hiring on its job posting templates. This enhancement allows hiring managers to review job descriptions and add relevant skills directly within the posting—without navigating across multiple pages. As a result, they can complete job postings more quickly, reducing back-and-forth navigation and saving valuable time. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

2.  Get Smarter with AI-Powered Qualification Recommendations 

Buyers often spend time reviewing old postings trying to remember which skills to include—or forget key qualifications altogether. 

With AI-powered qualification recommendations, SAP Fieldglass uses machine learning to analyze your job title and description. It then suggests relevant skills. Buyers can easily add them to postings, ensuring consistency and completeness. Suppliers, in turn, align workforce records to these skills, improving match quality. 

 Use Case: 
A healthcare provider hiring temporary nurses across multiple locations used AI recommendations to surface essential skills like ICU experience and EMR familiarity. By including these automatically suggested qualifications, they received better-aligned candidates and reduced supplier clarifications. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

3. Bring Consistency with the Unified Qualification Library 

Ever noticed how “Azure Cloud,” “Azure”, and “MS Azure” all describe the same skill? When buyers use varied terminology, comparing candidates’ terminology and the buyer’s terminology becomes a nightmare for the suppliers. 

The SAP Fieldglass Unified Qualification Library solves this by consolidating all qualification data into a Unified Qualification Library. Suppliers can merge duplicate skills, retain assessment ratings, and permanently align workforce data with buyer requirements. 

This consistency reduces errors, accelerates submissions, and ensures that skills mean the same thing across the board. 

 Use Case: 
A global IT services firm once had to manually reconcile skill names across five suppliers. With the unified library, “Java Developer” and “J2EE Developer” are automatically consolidated, and machine learning flags exact matches to the buyer’s terminology of their requirements. The result? Less admin work and faster, more accurate candidate evaluations. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

4. Assessment Scale Normalization 

Different buyers often use different rating scales for the same skill—one might rate Excel proficiency 1–3, another 1–5. That inconsistency makes fair comparisons difficult. 

SAP Fieldglass now normalizes assessment scales across postings and workforce records. All SAP Fieldglass Unified Qualification scales are standardized to a 1–5 scale, with updates synchronized in real time. 

Use Case: 
An engineering firm hiring external project managers saw varied skill ratings across buyers. Normalization of the SAP Fieldglass Unified Qualifications on candidate's workforce record to a common 1-5 scale ensures every candidate was evaluated accurately and and that evaluations are easy to maintain. 

An Important aspect of this feature is that the workforce record always uses a standardized 1–5 scale. If a buyer uses a different rating scale—for example, 1–10—the system automatically converts the workforce rating to match. So, if a worker’s Java skill is rated 5 on the 1–5 scale, it will display as 10 on the buyer’s 1–10 scale. 

5. Skill-based Matching of  Potential Candidates 

Previously, SAP Fieldglass matched potential candidates only by job code, which sometimes meant great talent slipped through the cracks because the system overlooked highly qualified candidates whose job codes didn’t exactly match. 

Now, potential candidates are identified based on either job code or matching qualifications. The enhanced modal appears directly in the Qualifications section and displays match percentages for quick evaluation. Only candidates with at least a 25% qualification match are shown—helping buyers or hiring managers focus on the most relevant profiles. 

Use Case: 

 A company hiring logistics coordinators during peak season found candidates who didn’t share the same job code but matched key qualifications. The system flagged one with a 70% match, helping recruiters fill roles faster. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Quick Tips and Things to Know 

  • The Enable Skills-Based Hiring flag must first be unhidden and unlocked at the contingent type level before it appears on job posting templates. 
  • Updating the Enable Skills-Based Hiring flag doesn’t affect existing postings—only new ones inherit the change. 
  • Ensure workforce records are updated before relying on AI recommendations for accurate results. 
  • Consent is required before viewing recommended qualifications. 
  • Potential Candidates are displayed only if their match rate is 25% or higher. 

Skills-based hiring isn’t just about finding candidates—it’s about finding the right candidates, faster. With these enhancements, SAP Fieldglass empowers organizations to standardize skill data, streamline job postings, and make data-driven hiring decisions with confidence.  

Have you tried skills-based hiring in SAP Fieldglass? Share your experiences in the comments, and don’t forget to check the documentation on the SAP Fieldglass Help Portal for more insights. 

You can also have a look at the following topics in the What’s New Viewer for SAP Fieldglass for more details: 

  • Enable Skills-Based Hiring Flag Enhancements 
  • Skills-Based Matching of Potential Candidates 
  • SAP Fieldglass Unified Qualification Library Enhancements

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: SAP Public Cloud, agilidade e ganhos com ERP em Nuvem
entry.content:
El SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025 nos regaló una charla esclarecedora de @Jean_Chess_IT Jean Tiago Baena, Director de Chess SAP Services y consultor SAP MM con más de 18 años de experiencia en implementaciones SAP ECC y S/4 HANA con actuación en proyectos globales. Jean, quien comenzó como frentista en un puesto de gasolina y hoy dirige su propia consultoría SAP en Londrina, nos guió a través de un fascinante viaje sobre cómo SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud está transformando la manera en que las empresas gestionan sus procesos de negocio.


Los Dolores Encontrados en las Empresas
Jean identificó claramente las principales dolores que las empresas enfrentan hoy cuando piensan en tecnología ERP:

  • Falta de agilidad para adaptación - Muchos empresarios piensan que es muy demorado y costoso
  • Procesos ineficientes y desconectados
  • Falta de transparencia en automatizaciones
  • Preocupación con seguridad digital
  • Demora en obtener un sistema actualizado - Un tiempo muy largo para tener tecnología de última generación

Como destacó Jean: "Los empresarios siempre piensan que quieren la mejor tecnología de última generación, más cuando piensan en invertir, piensan que es una dolor de cabeza, es demorado y las mejores prácticas son difíciles de ejecutar."

GROW with SAP: Las Soluciones
Jean presentó cómo GROW with SAP resuelve estas dolores:

  • Implantación rápida de nuevos negocios y expansión - Implementación muy rápida de rollouts para nuevas filiales
  • Procesos alineados con las mejores prácticas globales de la industria - Un sistema "ready to run", pronto para usar
  • Entendimiento de lo que es más crítico y lo que realmente impacta para automatización
  • Confianza en actualizaciones de seguridad continua en empresa certificada
  • Adopción de un sistema "pronto para rodar" que crece con el negocio

Dos Caminos: RISE y GROW with SAP
Jean explicó las dos abordajes que SAP ofrece:
RISE with SAP: Para procesos muy complejos, compañías muy grandes como compañías de petróleo, compañías globales con negocios muy complejos.
GROW with SAP: Donde están las primeras inversiones de SAP en el mundo. Es un sistema que puede ser implementado muy rápido en las compañías. La migración para compañías que usan Business One es muy más fácil porque hay una integración muy rápida.


Tiempos de Implementación: La Gran Diferencia
Jean mostró datos concretos sobre los tiempos de implementación:

  • SAP S/4 HANA Cloud: Media de 4.5 meses (1 a 9 meses)
  • Conversión típica de sistema: 8 a 12 meses
  • Implementación S/4 HANA on-premise (full suite): 11 a 15 meses
  • Implementaciones complejas (full suite): 10 a 48+ meses

Actualizaciones Continuas: Innovación sin Proyectos
Uno de los puntos más destacados por Jean fue el modelo de actualizaciones:

Actualizaciones dos veces por año: En febrero y en agosto hay upgrade automático.
Como Jean explicó: "Quien hoy trabaja con SAP sabe que un upgrade es algo complejo, demorado, que muda toda la compañía. Hay que pensar en desarrollos Z, programas Z que serán afectados, muchos tests, costo, tiempo..."
En Cloud ERP: "Las actualizaciones son dos veces por año, y el cliente no precisa planear nada. Los updates son automáticos por SAP. Globalmente su ERP, su sistema está actualizado en todos los países de una sola vez."
Las versiones siguen el modelo: 2508, 2602, 2608, 2702... sin necesidad de proyectos de upgrade.

Cloud ERP Inteligente: Las Características

  • Pronto para usar
  • Actualizado con las mejores prácticas
  • Continua innovación hecha por SAP
  • Simplificación de tareas diarias
  • Crecimiento de negocios soportado por SAP
  • Seguridad con actualización constante

La Experiencia del Usuario
Jean mostró la evolución dramática de la interfaz SAP, desde las pantallas en blanco y negro del R/2 (años 80), pasando por versiones más amigables de los 90, el SAP GUI tradicional, hasta llegar a la moderna interfaz Fiori donde:

  • Apps organizadas como favoritos - Como en una web o celular
  • Pantallas totalmente customizadas por perfil de acceso
  • Noticias y conexión con informaciones de la compañía
  • Videos integrados en el sistema
  • Total compatibilidad con movilidad - Teléfonos, dispositivos móviles
  • Indicadores de Business Intelligence en la palma de la mano

Mejores Prácticas Nativas: SAP Signavio Process Navigator
Durante la presentacion se demostró cómo las mejores prácticas vienen preconfiguradas en el sistema, listas para activar directamente.
Fit-to-Standard: El Nuevo Paradigma
Jean fue enfático sobre el cambio de mentalidad necesario:
"Las compañías van a pensar más en usar SAP Standard, no más tantos desarrollos, no más tantas customizaciones, porque el estándar es pensado, es desarrollado por muchos años para contener las mejores prácticas."
"Los clientes solamente adoptan y usan, no piensan 'voy a mudar ese SAP porque mi negocio es diferente'. Ya viene con las mejores prácticas y los clientes se adaptan a esta fe de no querer transformar SAP con customizaciones que van a demorar, gastar."
La ventaja: "Si tiene un modelo estándar, puede trabajar en Paraguay, Argentina, Estados Unidos, Brasil, Europa con el mismo, sin mudanzas. Y ahí esto es más ágil y con costo menor."

Metodología SAP Activate
fases del proyecto:

  • Discover - Definición inicial del scope
  • Prepare - Preparación para Fit-to-Standard con Business Driven Configuration
  • Explore - Workshop Fit-to-Standard mostrando procesos y scripts
  • Realize - Implementación

"Cuando se asigna un contrato, hoy o mañana ya puede usar el sistema. En modelos anteriores, se esperaba 30, 60 días para tener una base de datos de SAP. Ahora, el contrato está firmado y los días siguientes ya puede hacer un logon en el sistema."

Implementación en Paraguay y Argentina: Jean destacó que en países como Paraguay y Argentina, donde no hay localizaciones tan complejas como Brasil, "es mucho más rápido". En Brasil, los impuestos son "los más complejos del mundo", pero en países con pocas diferenciaciones de cargos e impuestos, la implementación es "muy más ágil y con menor costo".
El proyecto típico de Public Cloud es de 4 a 6 meses.
Configuración sin SPRO: Central Business Configuration
Jean explicó el cambio fundamental en la configuración:
"No más tenemos las configuraciones que conocemos como SPRO. Ahora hacemos configuraciones con CBC, Central Business Configuration."

Extensibilidad con SAP BTP
Opciones de extensibilidad:
Low Code / No Code:

  • Bajo código de programación
  • Trabajamos en la pantalla moviendo campos con el mouse
  • Custom Fields, Custom Business Objects, Custom CDS Views
  • Custom Analytical Queries
  • Output Management customizado

Pro Code:

  • Posibilidad de crear apps usando APIs e integraciones
  • APIs como "manera moderna de conectar sistemas, hacer customizaciones, volcarlas para web"
  • "Flexibilidad controlada para atender necesidades específicas"

Joule: Inteligencia Artificial Integrada
Jean finalizó mostrando Joule, la inteligencia artificial nativa de SAP que ya viene integrada en Cloud ERP:
"La agilidad, la información va a estar en la mano de ustedes, de usuarios, de gerentes, de directores. En una reunión de negocios, en un viaje que precisa acceder a los datos, ya está todo en la palma de la mano."

Cómo funciona Joule:

  • Chat dentro del sistema
  • Consultas en lenguaje natural: "Quiero un gráfico de las ventas, cuánto estoy facturando"
  • Responde "como personas reales con la inteligencia artificial"
  • "No voy a más buscar un reporte, voy a preguntar: 'Por favor, quiero saber cómo está finanzas en abierto, documentos a pagar, cuánto se pagó hoy' y viene automáticamente"

El Mensaje Final
Jean cerró su presentación destacando que la información está ahora al alcance de todos, fácil y rápido, permitiendo tomar decisiones de negocio desde cualquier lugar.
La transformación es clara: De un ERP complejo y demorado a una plataforma ágil, con mejores prácticas globales, actualizaciones automáticas, y una experiencia de usuario moderna que pone la información en la palma de la mano.

Agradecimientos especiales a Chess SAP Services por compartir esta valiosa experiencia y al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025 por crear este espacio de aprendizaje.


SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: OData Delta extract failing with error RSODP_ODATA042.
entry.content:
Dear Sap Community

We are facing an issue with one custom Delta Extract service where it works for Full extract but after a few delta extracts, it starts failing with error RSODP_ODATA042. 

Full Error message:

Failure happened on 'Source' side. ErrorCode=ODataRequestNotSucceeded,'Type=Microsoft.DataTransfer.Common.Shared.HybridDeliveryException,Message=Requesting response from path DeltaLinksOfFactsOfZEWM_PROD_NEW('D20251113231117_000041000')//ChangesAfter and query $filter=&sap-client=400 failed with status code BadRequest and message <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><error xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/ado/2007/08/dataservices/metadata"><code>RSODP_ODATA/042</… xml:lang="en">S:RSODP_ODATA:042</message><innererror><application><component_id/><service_namespace>/SAP/</service_namespace><service_id>ZEWM_PROD_MASTER_ODP_NEW_SRV</service_id><service_version>0001</service_version></application><transactionid>D8C8D15E33990390E006919C91406949</transactionid><timestamp>20251116224624.6897370</timestamp><Error_Resolution><SAP_Transaction>For backend administrators: run transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG on SAP Gateway hub system and search for entries with the timestamp above for more details</SAP_Transaction><SAP_Note>See SAP Note 1797736 for error analysis

 

We have tried to create new CDS/Service as well and face same issue again. Also, the message RSODP_ODATA042 does not exists in our EWM system yet where this service call is failing. If we do a Full extract again which resets the Delta counter, it again works for a few times for delta extract before again failing with same error.

entry.title: Unlock Base AI Package for SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud – Enjoy Joule and Embedded AI Features for Free
entry.content:
With the release of version 2508, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is taking a significant leap forward in enhancing user experience by offering Joule and Embedded AI features as part of its Base AI package.

These features are designed to streamline daily operations and provide a more intuitive interaction with your ERP system—all come at NO additional cost. They can be easily activated through the Base AI package or are already included in your standard cloud subscription, providing unrestricted access without the need for additional AI unit purchases.

Here's what you need to know about the scope of these AI features, along with guidance on how to activate them and set them up in your system.

 

Joule Base AI Features

Meet Joule, your all-in-one AI co-pilot in the SAP ecosystem, designed to simplify your work processes by providing an intuitive, personalized, and smart user experience. With skills and capabilities that cover a wide array of tasks, Joule supports approximately 80% of the most frequently used business processes in SAP cloud applications.

  • Informational Capabilities: Joule delivers concise responses to user inquiries made in natural language, offering helpful content summaries to assist you effectively.
  • Navigational Capabilities: It recommends relevant applications to ensure a seamless workflow, with over 500 navigation scenarios in SAP Cloud ERP.
  • Transactional Capabilities: Joule provides detailed insights into business objects without needing to open specific applications, facilitating direct management of tasks with more than 45 transaction scenarios.

Activation Method: Easily activate Joule features by visiting the SAP Store.

You can self-order the free SKU through the SAP Store or contact your sales representative to place an order. Visit the SAP Store page to explore and activate Joule Base AI authorization.

For detailed steps and guidance, refer to the following resources

  1. Initial Setup
  2. Joule Onboarding Guide
  3. Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Additionally, SAP provides guided missions through the Discovery Center to help you complete Joule's configuration:

  1. Establish a Unified Joule Instance
  2. Activate Joule with SAP Cloud ERP 

 

Embedded Base AI Features

These features are seamlessly integrated into your cloud ERP modules, significantly improving operational efficiency by automating and simplifying tasks.

  • Smart Summarization: Generate intelligent summaries of business objects designed with Fiori Elements.
  • Easy Filter: Use natural language to describe the data you need and filter reports effectively, applicable across more than 1,100 reports.
  • Enterprise Search: Perform comprehensive searches using natural language.

Activation Method: To activate these features, users or partners need to register and accept SAP AI terms once, after which SAP will enable the AI features and inform you.

SAP offers comprehensive configuration and user guides for these capabilities:

  • Smart Summarization Configuration Guide 和User Guide
  • Easy Filter Configuration Guide 和User Guide
  • Enterprise SearchConfiguration Guide 和User Guide

 

Machine Learning Base AI Features

As part of the foundational AI package, these machine learning capabilities automate and streamline specific business processes, offering significant operational benefits without any additional cost or licensing requirements.

  • Sales Order Extraction: Automatically create sales orders from unstructured data such as PDF or image format purchase orders.
  • Sales Order Auto Completion: Provide suggestions for missing data fields in sales documents to expedite the completion of sales orders and customer return orders.

Activation Method: These machine learning features are part of the embedded AI capabilities and require no extra licensing. They are included in the standard cloud subscription, offering unrestricted access.

  • Create Sales Orders - Automatic Extraction | SAP Help Portal
  • Recommendation-Assisted Sales Order Completion | SAP Help Portal

 

Leverage the full power of SAP's AI investments by exploring and activating these features today.

With the embedded AI features, Joule's capabilities, and machine learning scenarios, you can enhance user satisfaction, boost productivity, and save time, making your business operations more efficient than ever.

For more information and a comprehensive overview of the features, please visit the following blogs:

Try the latest AI features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Pu... - SAP Community

entry.title: Feasibility check on data migration approach from Pega Cloud to SAP BTP
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

We are currently defining the data layer modernization strategy for a client planning to rebuild their existing Pega-based case management and workflow solution on SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP). 

The main ask from Client is if SAP BTP offers the same or better functionality to rebuild the CPPO Application with all the specification and implementation the client currently has available for the CPPO on ASPIRE Version.

Since the underlying PostgreSQL database in Pega is tightly coupled with the Pega application and not directly accessible externally, we are proposing a staged extraction and migration approach using the Pega BIX tool.

Below is the detailed end-to-end data flow and migration approach we would like SAP to validate for compliance and supportability within the BTP ecosystem:

Proposed Data Flow

  1. Source System (Pega Application):

    • Data to be extracted using Pega BIX tool in Database Schema output format.

    • Extracted data stored in Pega Cloud File Storage, as per standard Pega BIX process.

  2. Staging Database Setup:

    • Files from Pega Cloud File Storage transferred securely (via SFTP or equivalent) to a Staging PostgreSQL Database, deployed within the same hyperscaler region where SAP BTP is hosted (e.g., AWS, Azure, or GCP).

    • This staging environment will be used for initial validation, transformation, and reconciliation of extracted data.

  3. Migration to SAP BTP Data Layer:

    • Data from the Staging PostgreSQL DB will be migrated to the SAP BTP Hyperscaler Managed PostgreSQL service using native PostgreSQL utilities such as pg_dump, pg_restore, or pg_basebackup alongside psql (for data validation)

    • Target PostgreSQL DB in SAP BTP will act as the primary persistence layer for new SAP Build Process Automation (BPA) and SAP Build Apps-based workflow applications with CAP service as API interfaces to that persistency layer.

Clarification Needed

Can anyone please validate on the following points:

  1. Whether this external data ingestion and migration pattern (Pega underlying PostgreSQL DB → Pega BIX tool → Staging PostgreSQL DB → Hyperscaler PostgreSQL in SAP BTP) is technically compliant and supported within SAP BTP guidelines.

  2. Whether any additional services such as SAP Data Intelligence, SAP Integration Suite, or SAP Data Provisioning Agent for better orchestration or governance in this migration pattern is required or only using PostgreSQL native utilities like pg_dump/pg_restore/psql is enough. 

BR,

Som

#Pega #SAPBTP #MigrateFromPegaToSAPBTP #HyperscalerPostgreSQLOption

entry.title: The Art and Science of SAPUI5 in SAP Build: Insights from SAP TechEd 2025
entry.content:
At SAP TechEd Berlin 2025, we had the opportunity to present “The Art and Science of SAPUI5 in SAP Build.” The deep dive session explores how SAPUI5, SAP’s strategic UI framework, is transforming user experiences and developer efficiency across SAP. This blog post shares key takeaways from the session and questions from the audience.
If you’ve missed it, watch the session recording in AD106v | The art and science of SAPUI5 in SAP Build.


The Art of SAPUI5 in SAP Fiori User Experience

SAP’s approach to user experience (UX) centers on making applications easier and more enjoyable to use, helping users accomplish their tasks with greater efficiency and satisfaction. The framework enables the SAP Fiori design system to evolve seamlessly across SAP solutions, providing flexible tools for developers to efficiently build apps using SAP Build Code.

SAP Web Components: Bridging Frameworks and Enhancing Extensibility

SAP Web Components extend the capabilities of SAPUI5, to other programming model, such as Angular, React, or Vue. This interoperability supports a consistent and streamlined UX throughout the SAP portfolio. SAP Web Components can now also be easily consumed in SAPUI5 apps just like regular controls. Going forward, SAP plans to provide new UI elements as SAP Web Components, minimizing the effort required for adopting new standards and ensuring compliance with SAP guidelines and modern Web standards.

SAPUI5 is leading is the Way in Accessibility

SAPUI5 is at the forefront of accessibility, with recent implementations (SAPUI5 1.136 and UI5 Web Components 2.9.0) aligned to the latest Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2. This commitment ensures that applications built with SAPUI5 are inclusive and accessible to users worldwide, meeting diverse needs and regulatory requirements.


The Science of SAPUI5 in SAP Build

SAP Build is SAP’s unified solution to build apps and extensions, automations, agents and digital workspaces. SAP Build helps to increase developer productivity and to future-proof IT investments by leveraging proven technologies like SAPUI5, SAP Fiori elements, CAP and ABAP Cloud.

Extending SAP standard apps with SAPUI5 flexibility and Clean Core

SAPUI5 flexibility enables upgrade-safe, clean core extensions with intuitive low-code/no-code tools for different personas: end users, key users, and developers. New capabilities include consistent text changes for field labels and a “What's New” / “UI Adaptation Tour” for key users. Developers creating adaptation projects benefit from a "Replace original tile option and coding efficiency with TypeScript and Joule.

The new SAPUI5 runtime repository accelerates patch updates, improves startup performance, and supports zero-downtime deployments.

Future-Proofing apps with UI5 best practices and UI5 linter

Technical debt and legacy code can slow down innovation within SAP Fiori projects. Here the UI5 linter helps finding and fixing the usage of deprecated APIs and making your code is ready for upcoming SAPUI5 versions. The new SAPUI5 / OpenUI5 legacy-free version helps validating how compliant your code is to UI5 best practices, i.e. ensuring your code is state of the art and future-proof.

AI-Powered Development: Joule Copilot and MCP server

AI is revolutionizing SAPUI5 development. The Joule copilot accelerates app creation, view and control addition, code formatting, migration to TypeScript and much more. The UI5 MCP server enables agentic AI app development in SAP Build, combining generative AI with algorithmic logic if the UI5 linter.


Key Takeaways

  • SAPUI5 delivers a streamlined, consistent UX across SAP Business Suite, driving both user satisfaction and business outcomes.
  • SAP Build and SAPUI5 flexibility empower organizations to extend SAP standard apps efficiently, future-proofing their investments.
  • AI-powered tools accelerate development and let you future-proof your apps with UI5 best practices.

 

Selected questions from the audience

Q: Is Using VS code still recommended or the SAP Build for development

A:  In addition to the turnkey solution of SAP Build running on SAP BTP, SAP plans to focus on releasing development tools on the VS Code marketplace. VS Code is the number-one IDE worldwide, especially among web, cloud, and full-stack developers. Investing more in VS Code helps SAP meet developers where they are, making it easier for new developers to adopt SAP technologies (such as CAP, SAP BTP, SAPUI5, ABAP Cloud).

Q: New controls will be components from now on?

A: Exactly, SAP plans to deliver most new UI components as Web Components, which can be use across any Web framework, including SAPUI5.

Q: How AI compatibilities work in more complex application

A: Beyond Generative AI capabilities, agentic development tool (e.g. with the UI5 MCP server) offer impressive results for developing complex (fullstack) apps, from design up to deployment. You might want to check out Inside Joule: Lessons from building an AI coding assistant for SAP Build for an inside view.

Q: What is the benefit of using the Web Components from the example compared to sap.m.Input?

A: Please continue using SAPUI5 controls if they fulfil your needs. There is no change to that. Most upcoming, new UI elements will be provided as Web Component, serving *all* technology stacks, including SAPUI5.

Q: What are Components bringing when compared to Classic controls if we are using UI5 only approach

A: see above

Q: how will be the future scope of Fiori elements applications over ui5, do both will have same scope

A: SAP Fiori elements is an option to develop SAPUI5 app more efficiently. SAP recommends using as much SAP Fiori elements as possible and as much freestyle SAPUI5 as needed. This is what we do in SAP as well. Check out the SAP Fiori Development Portal on more details.

Q: What would be best approach to extend freestyle standard Fiori apps? Also, will adaptation projects have more extension powers?

A: SAPUI5 flexibility to the strategic way to extend/adapt SAPUI5 apps. The UI5 team continues to invest a lot in this area, as it is top priority for many partners/customers. SAPUI5 flexibility covers freestyle SAPUI5 as well as apps built with SAP Fiori elements. Adaptation projects offer best capabilities to create future-proof app extensions.

Q: Will the Build Code Joule CoPilot also support the Vibe Coding with MCP in the future?

A: Yes, SAP plans for vibe coding tools (incl. MCP servers) in SAP Build to empower business users to create application prototypes and start new SAP solutions without heavy coding knowledge.

Q: SAP develops SAPUI5 while promoting low-code tools like RAP, CAP, and key user adaptations. Isn’t it inconsistent to advance the core framework while encouraging less direct UI5 development?

A: Key user adaptation as well as metadata- / annotation-driven apps on RAP/CAP (using SAP Fiori elements) all use SAPUI5 as their UI technology. Innovations ‘in the UI’ are built in SAPUI5, benefitting all these models. Also, there remains a strong use case for a freestyle SAPUI5 implementation approach for apps which cannot follow the patterns of SAP Fiori elements.

Q: As a partner, if we build an SAPUI5 application and deploy it to customer systems, can SAPUI5 flexibility be used to create customer specific adaption projects for it?

A: This is planned for Q4/2025: Developer adaptation: enabling customer and partner applications for adaptation projects (As always with forward-looking statements, this is subject to change.)

Q: The build errors just prove you are really building live and not faking it. 🙂

A: Right. Not sure though whether Tommy enjoyed the moment 😉

Q: Now that CDS support UI annotations will UI5 become obsolete?

A: Definitely not. SAPUI5 remains SAP’s strategic UI framework. SAP Fiori elements with its annotations is built on SAPUI5. The annotations control what SAPUI5 is showing.

entry.title: Handling Record Count Mismatches After HANA Tenant Copy During S/4HANA On-Premise to RISE Migration
entry.content:
As part of a system move, We performed a HANA tenant copy from our on-premise S/4HANA system to the RISE environment. After completing the tenant copy, we compared the total record count of the SAPABAP1 schema using:

SELECT SUM(RECORD_COUNT) FROM M_TABLES WHERE SCHEMA_NAME = 'SAPABAP1';

Source Record count:

Target Record count:

A small difference appeared between the source and the target system.
To validate the result, We first checked whether any column-store tables were unloaded using:

SELECT SCHEMA_NAME, TABLE_NAME FROM M_CS_TABLES WHERE LOADED = 'NO';

No unloaded tables were found, so the values from M_TABLES were correct for comparison.

To investigate the difference, I exported and compared the table-level record counts.

The mismatch came from the following tables:

Table Name

Source

Target

/BI0/0K00193590

1

0

/BI0/0K00193626

2

0

/BI0/0K00193632

2

0

/BI0/0K00193575

1

0

All of these objects belong to the /BI0/ namespace.

Information provided by SAP clarifies that these objects are temporary BW tables, as described in SAP Note 2800007.
They are created during BW processing and are not persistent.
Additional related details include:

  • Hash / union temporary tables (40-character names)
    These store intermediate results for hierarchy queries. They are copies of 0BW:BIA:BI0* objects with a retention time. Unneeded tables are removed using BW cleanup tools such as:
    • Report SAP_DROP_TMPTABLES
    • Function module TREX_DBS_DROP_BW_UNION_TABLES
      Notes 2838176 and 2852066 describe adjustments and cleanup behaviour.
  • Temporary tables in the pattern 0BW:BIA:BI0*
    These hold temporary hierarchy or F4 help data. They are cleaned automatically or through report RSDDTMPTAB_DELETE.
    SAP Note 3316894 describes a case where automatic cleanup may not run as expected.

According to this information, differences in these temporary table counts between systems are normal and depend on BW usage and cleanup cycles.

Conclusion: 

The record count mismatch observed after the HANA tenant copy was limited to BW temporary tables described in SAP Note 2800007. These tables are not persistent and may exist or be cleaned up at different times in different systems. Because of this, small differences in their record counts are expected and do not indicate any issue with the tenant copy. The overall tenant copy can be considered consistent and successfully completed.

entry.title: Cloud-first, AI-Powered test automation in SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
SmartBear participated in and won first prize at the ALMathon, the annual hackathon for SAP Partners. The challenge: Create innovative use cases to extend SAP Cloud ALM . So, we integrated Reflect, our AI-powered test automation product, into SAP Cloud ALM to enable users to automate their manual testing process.

Check out this demo to see it in action!

The urgent need for test automation

As organizations accelerate cloud adoption using RISE with SAP and as they keep up with frequent S/4HANA Cloud updates, testing early and often becomes essential. SAP’s own guidance highlights continuous delivery with frequent updates, which raises the bar on repeatable, reliable testing at scale.

Manual testing can be time-consuming, error-prone, and costly. It often becomes a bottleneck that delays releases and increases business risk. Studies have shown that embracing test automation can accelerate application delivery by up to 4× while reducing errors and risk. Teams moving from mostly manual testing to more automated approaches often save thousands of person-hours and cut testing costs by 25% or more. These benefits translate into faster, more confident deployments and fewer firefights in production.

 

A new approach to solving this problem

Reflect brings a cloud-first, AI-native experience directly into SAP Cloud ALM for test creation, execution, and results, while aligning with existing workflows that business stakeholders, IT leaders and software teams already use. Test creation, execution, and result reporting all happen within the familiar SAP Cloud ALM interface, so there’s no context-switching to external tools. Automated test results flow back into SAP Cloud ALM’s Test Management, so stakeholders can see pass/fail status and reports alongside processes, requirements, and manual tests.

 

Why is Reflect different from existing solutions?

First of all, there’s zero configuration, Reflect truly is cloud-first. No installations or browser extensions are required to start automating. There is no need to download any .exe files or Chrome extensions; you simply open SAP Cloud ALM and start creating tests. The solution runs entirely on a cloud platform, and all the heavy lifting (test execution engines, browsers, etc.) is handled in the cloud. There’s no need to set up local machines or maintain VMs for test runs because the infrastructure scales for you.

Reflect has no-code automation with AI-powered test creation, and there are two intuitive ways to create tests without writing a single script.

  • Record and play: This approach allows users to simply hit “Record” and then interact with the SAP application (or any web/mobile app) just as an end-user would. The tool captures each action and creates an automated test without the need for any manual scanning of objects to create models.
  • AI-powered: This approach enables users to automatically generate automated tests from existing manual test cases documented in SAP Cloud ALM with a click of a button. This capability shortens the path to automating existing tests and makes it easy to build new ones from scratch.

Lastly, Reflect’s application coverage is broad. Reflect supports test automation for all SAP cloud applications out of the box. Whether you’re testing SAP Fiori apps, S/4HANA transactions, SuccessFactors, Ariba, Concur, or any SAP application built with SAPUI5, Reflect can handle it. Reflect also supports non-SAP web applications and even mobile apps, enabling true end-to-end testing across hybrid workflows. In one platform, you get UI testing, API testing, and visual testing capabilities for web and mobile.

Reflects’s critical capabilities

 To further streamline test automation, Reflect provides several advanced capabilities that are worth highlighting. These include:

  • Reusable segments: Capture repeatable flows as reusable building blocks to speed up authoring and keep tests consistent
  • AI assisted self-healing: When the application UI updates or the underlying technology changes, tests continue to run, reducing maintenance effort over time
  • Simple and easy debugging: Users can troubleshoot their tests directly within the recording experience in case of errors vs going back and forth between the test modules and test execution
  • Execution suites: Users can create a playlist of tests using an easy-to-use flowchart, schedule them directly from the automation interface, and run as many tests as needed in parallel
  • Email and Slack notifications: When tests are complete, results are updated in SAP Cloud ALM, and users can configure them to be sent to their email, Slack, or MS Teams

 

Accelerate your SAP testing with Reflect

As SAP continues to accelerate its update cycle, organizations that can adapt quickly will be best positioned to succeed. By integrating Reflect's cloud-first, AI-powered test automation directly into SAP Cloud ALM, businesses can significantly reduce the friction associated with frequent updates. This integration enables teams to test earlier and more frequently, ensuring that their SAP environments remain stable and performant. With Reflect, organizations can achieve faster time-to-market, improved quality, and reduced testing costs.

Find us on the SAP Cloud ALM Partners – Extensions page to learn more.

entry.title: Re: Error: Select a key from the allowed namespace. Messa...
entry.content: This error, "Entry with key outside of the namespace you manage," typically occurs in SAP when you are attempting to create a new entry (like a Partner Function or Partner Determination Procedure) using a key (ID) that falls within the SAP standard namespace (keys starting with numbers, or letters A-X), even if you are trying to assign it to a Z or Y (customer-specific) object. The solution is to ensure both the Partner Determination Procedure ID (if you're creating a new one) and the Partner Function ID you are adding to the procedure must start with 'Z' or 'Y'. If the Partner Function itself (e.g., ZP) is already defined in the customer namespace but you are trying to insert it into a standard Partner Determination Procedure (e.g., SM0001), you should check if the error is due to the key of the determination procedure itself. If you've ensured both keys are Z/Y and the error persists, it may be a configuration issue specific to your system's upgrade protection or a custom object in a non-standard namespace that you are referencing, and you should check the object keys and number ranges in the underlying customization tables (like V_TPAR for Partner Functions or the relevant view for the Partner Determination Procedure).

entry.title: Re: Configuration settings for automatic PS Project creation from PPM Item
entry.content:
Hi @bapats123 :  Thank you for your insightful question. Here’s my response:

For smaller organizations where a single team is responsible for creating PPM Items and PS Projects, it may be beneficial to select the Edit checkbox. However, in larger organizations with multiple departments involved in creating PPM Items, adhering to the PS Coding Mask for PPM Item IDs can be challenging. If the PPM ID does not align with the next available PS Project Code, the PS Project will not be created, and the system may not generate any error messages. This can lead to confusion for consultants who may struggle to identify the underlying issue. I recommend testing this in your test system to gain a clearer understanding of my suggestion.

entry.title: Marketplace App Deployment & Lifecycle Management Using SAP DevOps Tools
entry.content:
This thread is dedicated to exploring how teams can efficiently deploy, manage, and optimize marketplace applications using the SAP DevOps ecosystem. Whether you're working with SAP Commerce Cloud, SAP BTP, or integrating custom marketplace features into an enterprise environment, DevOps plays a crucial role in ensuring smooth delivery and continuous improvement.

In this discussion, I’m inviting the community to share insights, experiences, and best practices related to:

  • Automating marketplace app deployments using SAP DevOps pipelines
  • End-to-end lifecycle management, from development to testing, rollout, monitoring, and iterative updates
  • Using SAP CI/CD services for stable and compliant releases
  • Versioning strategies, rollback plans, and handling multi-environment deployments
  • Integrating third-party tools (GitHub Actions, Jenkins, Azure DevOps, etc.) with SAP landscapes
  • Monitoring & observability using SAP tools or external solutions
  • Managing extensions, microservices, and custom modules within marketplace ecosystems
  • Security, governance, and compliance across the deployment lifecycle
  • Common challenges teams face and how you’ve solved them

If you’ve built or maintained a marketplace app within the SAP ecosystem—or if you're working on improving your DevOps workflow—your insights can help others in the community. Share your methods, lessons learned, tool recommendations, or even questions you're stuck on.

entry.title: Re: Customer Master Data - Updation in SAP S/4 Hana Publi...
entry.content:
Hello Chris1973

Hope you are doing well.

In SAP Public Cloud, the Migration Cockpit is often misunderstood when it comes to data changes. The Migration Cockpit only allows you to upload data.
You cannot update or change existing data using the Migration Cockpit (I’ll try after your suggestion). This tool is strictly meant for initial data migration.

So, I am trying to use “Manage Mass Maintenance – Business Partner”

To update Business Partner data, you need to use the Manage Mass Maintenance – Business Partner application.

However, you can only perform updates when the Mass Update Template is available within the app and that is where the real catch was. This was the point I had been missing during the entire process.

Before the Mass Update Template appears in the app, you must first enable the related activity in the system (from Implementation activity).
Once this activity is activated, the template becomes visible and you can successfully perform mass updates on Business Partner data.

I have now resolved the issue, and everything is working correctly.

Thank you for your support, and thank you as well for your helpful suggestions throughout the process.

Best Regards,

Tehreem Fatima

entry.title: Unable to start BTP ABAP Environment via Landscape Portal – "System expected element 'object'"
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

this morning I tried to start my BTP ABAP Environment using the Landscape Portal, the same way I have done several times before. However, the environment no longer starts and instead shows the error message: System expected element 'object'.



When clicking Start, the portal triggers a batch request that fails with 400 Bad Request. The response payload looks like this:

{
   "error":{
      "code":"/A4CLP/MSH_MSG/000",
      "message":"System expected element 'object'",
      "@SAP__common.ExceptionCategory":"Provider_Application_Error",
      "innererror":{
         "ErrorDetails":{
            "@SAP__common.Application":{
               "ComponentId":"BC-ESI-ESF-GW",
               "ServiceRepository":"SRVD",
               "ServiceId":"/A4CLP/MNG_SYS_HIBERNATE_SRV",
               "ServiceVersion":"0001"
            },
            "@SAP__common.TransactionId":"61D0A68A790F482F85DBC57866695E9A",
            "@SAP__common.Timestamp":"20251117064124.696085",
            "@SAP__common.ErrorResolution":{
               "Analysis":"Use ADT feed reader \"SAP Gateway Error Log\" or run transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG on SAP Gateway hub system and search for entries with the timestamp above for more details",
               "Note":"See SAP Note 1797736 for error analysis (https://service.sap.com/sap/support/notes/1797736)"
            }
         }
      }
   }
}

The instance used to start without issues. Now the start operation consistently fails with this error.

Has anyone seen this issue before or knows what might cause this error? Is this related to Free-Tier environments, or is there any known outage or workaround?

Thanks for any insights!

SAP BTP ABAP environment

entry.title: Re: India: Export with Payment of Tax - eInvoicing
entry.content:
Dear Annika,

EXPWP (Export with Pay) is determined automatically for export invoices when taxes are calculated in the invoice. No special configuration is needed solely to set EXPWP.

If taxes are calculated in the invoice but are missing from the e-invoice XML:

  • Verify that “Classify Condition Types for Goods and Services Tax for India” is correctly maintained for the relevant pricing procedure.
  • Ensure all GST-relevant condition types used in pricing are properly classified so the tax amounts flow into the XML payload.

If the issue persists, raise an SAP incident under component CA-GTF-CSC-EDO-IN-IV and include sample invoice numbers, pricing/tax screenshots, and the generated XML payload.

Best regards,

Ravivarma

entry.title: How to Conditionally Hide Attributes and Sections in SAP Commerce Backoffice Using Dynamic Forms
entry.content:
Background:

SAP Commerce Backoffice introduced Dynamic Forms to make the Editor Area and wizard UI more flexible and context-aware. Instead of showing all fields statically, Dynamic Forms allow you to show/hide fields, sections, or tabs based on the current model values, without any Java customization.

This feature improves Backoffice usability and allows developers to control the UI using simple XML rules.

Problem Statement :

We want to achieve two requirements in the Product Editor Area:

  1. Hide a specific attribute (e.g., saturatedFat and unSaturatedFat) based on a condition.
  2. Hide an entire section (e.g., nutrition or manufacturing section) unless certain product properties are available.

How can this be implemented using Dynamic Forms?

Solution:

Below is a working configuration example that demonstrates:

  1. How to define the editor area for the Product.
  2. How to hide an entire section using df:section with visibleIf conditions.
  3. How to hide a specific attribute using df:attribute.

1. Editor Area Configuration

The following XML defines multiple sections in the Product editor area:

<context merge-by="type" parent="GenericItem" type="Product">
	<context component="base">
		<y:base>
			<y:labels>
				<y:label>code</y:label>
			</y:labels>
		</y:base>
	</context>

	<context component="editor-area">
		<editorArea:editorArea xmlns:editorArea="http://www.hybris.com/cockpitng/component/editorArea">

			<editorArea:tab name="hmc.tab.Product.detail">

				<!-- Product Basic Details -->
				<editorArea:section name="hmc.section.product.detail">
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="code"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="name"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="catalogVersion" readonly="true"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="approvalStatus"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="minOrderQuantity"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="maxOrderQuantity"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="showNutrition"/>
				</editorArea:section>

				<!-- Nutrition Section -->
				<editorArea:section name="hmc.section.product.nutrition.detail">
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="calories"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="protein"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="carbohydrate"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="cholesterol"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="totalFat"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="saturatedFat"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="unSaturatedFat"/>
				</editorArea:section>

				<!-- Manufacturing Details -->
				<editorArea:section name="hmc.section.product.mfg.detail">
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="manufacturer"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="dateOfManufacture"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="dateOfExipry"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="countryOfOrigin"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="seller"/>
					<editorArea:attribute qualifier="soldToCountries"/>
				</editorArea:section>
			</editorArea:tab>
		</editorArea:editorArea>
	</context>
​

2. Applying Dynamic Forms for Conditional Visibility

Hide a Section Based on a Condition

Hide Nutrition Section if showNutrition = false
Hide Manufacturing Section if manufacturer is null

<context component="editorAreaDynamicForms" merge-by="module">
	<df:dynamicForms xmlns:df="http://www.hybris.com/cockpitng/component/dynamicForms">

		<df:section id="nutritionSection"
			triggeredOn="showNutrition"
			qualifier="hmc.section.product.nutrition.detail"
			visibleIf="showNutrition==true"/>

		<df:section id="manufacturerSection"
			triggeredOn="manufacturer"
			qualifier="hmc.section.product.mfg.detail"
			visibleIf="manufacturer!=null"/>
	</df:dynamicForms>
</context>

3. Hide a Specific Attribute Dynamically

Example: Show saturatedFat and unSaturatedFat only when totalFat > 10

<context component="editorAreaDynamicForms">
	<df:dynamicForms>

		<df:attribute id="ProductSaturatedFat"
			qualifier="saturatedFat"
			triggeredOn="totalFat"
			visibleIf="totalFat > 10"/>

		<df:attribute id="ProductUnSaturatedFat"
			qualifier="unSaturatedFat"
			triggeredOn="totalFat"
			visibleIf="totalFat > 10"/>

	</df:dynamicForms>
</context>

Conclusion

Dynamic Forms provide a powerful and flexible mechanism to build context-aware, data-driven screens in SAP Commerce Backoffice. By leveraging df:section and df:attribute, you can:

  • Hide or show entire sections
  • Hide or show specific attributes
  • Create responsive editor areas that adapt to model values
  • Improve Backoffice usability and reduce clutter for business users

This approach eliminates the need for custom Java implementations and keeps the Backoffice configuration clean and maintainable.

If your project requires conditional UI behavior in Backoffice, Dynamic Forms should be your first choice.

entry.title: Integrate GitHub Copilot with SAP Cloud Application Studio
entry.content:
Requirement: 
To integrate GitHub Copilot with SAP Cloud Application Studio.

Introduction:
GitHub Copilot integration in Visual Studio Code offers powerful AI assistance for SAP Cloud Application Studio developers working on SAP C4C. It helps transform natural language prompts into ABSL scripts, automates repetitive coding tasks, and enhances logic building with intelligent suggestions. By streamlining development and reducing manual effort, Copilot boosts productivity and supports faster delivery of high-quality solutions.

Benefits of GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio/Cloud Application Studio

  • Supports complex logic building by offering real-time suggestions for conditional flows, loops, and data manipulations in ABSL.
  • Boosts productivity by reducing time spent on boilerplate code, allowing developers to focus on business-specific requirements.
  • Improves accuracy by minimizing syntax errors and offering context-aware completions based on SAP C4C development patterns.
  • Encourages collaboration by making code easier to understand and maintain, especially for teams working across different modules or geographies.

Sign In with GitHub Account:
STEP 1:
Click on GitHub Copilot -> Open Chat Window to Sign In

STEP 2:
GitHub Copilot login page will be opened. Click on “Sign up for Copilot Free”

STEP 3:
Signup page will be opened. Click on “Create an account”.

STEP 4:
Enter user details and create an account.

STEP 5:
Open SDK and click on “Sign In”

STEP 6:
Click on “Authorize github”

STEP 7:
User can access GitHub copilot now in SAP Cloud Application studio.

Open GitHub Chat:
GitHub copilot can be opened in two ways,

  • Separate Chat window.
  • Copilot assistant in script file.

1)Separate chat window.
Click on GitHub Copilot -> Open Chat Window

A copilot chat window will be open separately as shown below.

2)Copilot assistant in script file.
Open script file and click on “Ask Copilot” from the menu option

Copilot chat option will be opened inside the script file.

Start Typing with Comments or Partial Code:
CASE 1: ABSL Scripting Assistance
Copilot helps generate ABSL (Advanced Business Scripting Language) code by interpreting natural language prompts. Whether you're writing BeforeSave, AfterModify, or ValidationOnSave scripts, Copilot can suggest logic structures, syntax, and even error handling patterns, reducing development time and minimizing syntax errors.
Example:

  • Prompt: “write code to raise an error message, if the email ID is testmail@gmail.com”

Prompt response:

CASE 2 : Review and refine code
If you're working with legacy or repetitive code, Copilot can help refactor loops, simplify conditions, and remove redundancy. It acts like a virtual reviewer, offering cleaner alternatives and improving overall code quality.
Example:

  • Prompt:” Identify the lines of code which has dump issues and fix it.”

    In below screen shot Copilot Identified the inconsistent lines in red and provided fix/suggestions in green color.

Prompt response:

CASE 3: To Explain the code
GitHub Copilot uses AI to understand the context of your code and comments, offering real-time suggestions and explanations. It would help the developers in understanding the code quickly, there by saving the time and efforts for analysis.
Example:

  • Prompt: Explain me the selected lines of code

Prompt response:

  • Prompt: Explain me the code in the script file

Prompt response:

CASE 4: Basic syntax generation
GitHub Copilot can help developers working in SAP Cloud Application Studio by generating basic ABSL (Advanced Business Scripting Language) syntax. It understands the context of business objects and actions, offering ready-to-use code snippets like variable declarations, loops, and conditional statements. This accelerates development and reduces errors, especially for those new to ABSL.

Conclusion:
Using GitHub Copilot in SAP C4C development streamlines coding by offering intelligent suggestions tailored to the platform’s scripting and extension needs. It boosts developer productivity by reducing repetitive tasks and helping maintain clean, consistent code. Copilot also serves as a valuable learning aid for those new to SAP C4C, guiding them through SDK usage and integration patterns.

entry.title: OData Service: “No system alias found for service” after transport to QA – why is “LOCAL” missing?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’ve created an OData service that reads data from a custom table and provides PDF downloads. Everything is fully implemented and working in our development system (DEV). The service also runs fine in the Gateway Client (/IWFND/GW_CLIENT).

After transporting it to QA, I’m getting the following error in the Gateway Client:

500 – No system alias found for service

When I checked the service in QA via /IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE, I noticed that there is no system alias “LOCAL” defined at all.

This confused me because in DEV the service is assigned to the alias “LOCAL”, but in QA it doesn’t exist.

What also makes it strange:

Other OData services in QA and PROD are working fine—even though they also don’t have any system alias assigned. So the system somehow works without explicitly having “LOCAL” configured.

My questions:

Why does “LOCAL” exist in DEV but not in QA/PROD?

Shouldn’t this be consistent?

How is it possible that other OData services work without any system alias at all?

Is the system using some kind of implicit local alias?

What is the correct way to fix this issue for my new OData service?

Do I need to create the alias manually in QA, or is there a better approach?

How can I make sure that existing productive OData services won’t be affected by this configuration?
